Skyshine's BEDLAM
Skyshine's BEDLAM
Bedlam is a rogue-like with arcade style strategic turn-based combat set in a post-apocalyptic wasteland. Its unique blitz battle system is fast-paced where every move can lead to glory or ruin.

Read the full review here.

div.div:
October 14
Update 2.0 Ready for Community Testing
Update 2.0 Ready for Community Testing
What happened to update 1.75? We rolled ahead and are going straight to Skyshine’s Bedlam 2.0 since we actually included more in this update than what we initially planned. We’re not quite ready to make this public BUT if you’d like to hop on our beta branch via Steam we’d love to have your feedback and comments on it!
To Join Our Beta Branch and Test Skyshine’s Bedlam 2.0:
Right Click Skyshine’s Bedlam in your Steam Library
Go to Properties
Click on the “Betas” Tab
Enter Code “bedlamtest2015”
Click “Check Code”
Use the Drop Down Menu to select “Skyshines_Bedlam_Preview”
Right Click Skyshine’s Bedlam from your Library
Choose Delete Local Content
Install using the new branch
We’ll create a new sub-forum on Steam called Bedlam 2.0 Feedback that we’d love to have you folks leave your comments, issues, and suggestions in.
Overall the goal with 2.0 has been to implement the top 4 issues we’ve identified. If you want to get involved with a real grass roots game community join the discussion on our forums. We read every thread and we reply to as many as we can.
The main points for update 2.0 include the focus on:
Campaign added to unlock all the Dozers and clear the lands of the 4 factions. We also added Challenge mode and Practice mode.
Faction crew now have the faction abilities (i.e., mutants self heal, cyborgs augment, etc)
Overall game balance of events - Increasing the time spent doing meaningful things toward your goal of reaching Aztec City.
Implement a clear progression system for unlocking new dozers and adding new challenges for each Dozer.
Here are some more detailed notes on this update
Added Campaign, Practice, and Challenge mode.
Faction based crew abilities
More challenging to get to Aztec City
Balance pass on all events
Dozer unlock and progression
Balance associated with crew level ups and resource rewards
Fewer enemies at higher threat, but they are stronger.
Collected resources are now only what you pickup on the battlefield.
Optimized all battleboards to address black screen issue
Dozer unlocks now have a clear progression
Improved gameflow by removing events without meaningful outcomes.
Added volume controls for music and SFX
NOTE: Players will lose Dozer unlocks but not the achievements. Reason for this happening is that the new campaign format makes no sense really if you have dozers already unlocked.
Known Issues in the Preview Build
Detrigore win event and Imperatron win event are identical. These will be unique in the final update.
Glitch in the unlock dozer event where the first screen appears with no text for 4 of the 5 dozers.
Lazarus will offer a short introduction with Boneshaker explaining how you you can cleanse the lands of Bedlam
We have not thoroughly tested the scavenge ability for marauders
We have not balanced the final boss fight using Imperatron...It’s Epic.
We’re not sure when we’ll get this update out officially - but we’re hoping we can get it wrapped up quickly. Huge thanks again for all of your feedback and support along the way!
--Skyshine

October 8
Update 1.75 Coming Soon
We are currently working on our next update to Skyshine’s Bedlam and it’s coming along nicely, but taking some time.
Overall our goal with 1.75 has been to implement the top 3 issues we’ve identified. We love reading your feedback if you want to get involved with a real grass roots game community join the discussion on our forums. We read every thread and we reply to as many as we can. So what can you expect with 1.75?
This build has a challenging ‘brick by brick’ difficulty curve
Increase the time spent doing meaningful things toward your goal of reaching Aztec City.
Implement a clear progression system for unlocking new dozers and making them more relevant.
We’ll be sharing the exact details that are changing and being tweaked soon and we’ll also try to narrow down a release for this update too. This build also includes numerous bug fixes as well. Just wanted to let you all know that we are still reading feedback and working on getting as much of it implemented as we can. Thank you for support!
--Skyshine

div.p:
“You'll find that Bedlam faithfully recreates the feeling of Mad Max... It feels like a world gone mad, where anything can happen, and chaos reigns. Only your ability to adapt to the chaos will allow you to survive this wasteland.”
4/5 –
The Escapist
“Skyshine’s Bedlam is without a doubt a game tactical RPG fans should pick up.”
86/100 –
Mouse N Joypad
“Skyshine’s Bedlam improves upon the concept pioneered by The Oregon Trail, where players lead a caravan across a barbaric landscape, managing resources and facing random calamities and confrontations. While you may not die from dysentery in this vivid apocalypse, mutants, cyborgs, and flesh-rotting fruit fulfill that role in and out of combat.”
4.5/5 –
We Got This Covered

div.div:
About This Game
"I haven’t seen a better looking game this year." - Rock, Paper, Shotgun
You are the Mechanic, the last known member of a once-thriving guild of brilliant operators of the rolling fortresses called Dozers. You are in charge of commanding your crew in battles, managing your resources, improving your Dozer, interacting with various characters, and protecting your passengers while navigating through the post-apocalyptic wasteland. Your goal is to travel from the futuristic metropolis of Bysantine through the chaotic realm of Bedlam to reach the rumored utopia of Aztec City with as many of your passengers and crew intact as possible.
Key Features:
• A unique blitz battle system: Turn-based combat with swift play, over-the-top animations, action point based movement and attack system, environments and battles that gradually affect your team, crew-buffing Dozer equalizers, and tide-changing Dozer weapons!
• Four unique enemy factions: Marauders, Mutants, Cyborgs and the Rogue A.I. - all with their own appearances and behaviors.
• Rogue-like with RPG features: Randomly generated encounters and discoveries, meaningful permadeath, three different supplies to manage, crew veteran rankings and incredible replay value.
• “Double-Down”: A New game+; Travel back through Bedlam for the opportunity to defeat merciless overlord King Viscera and his minions for untold riches... or sacrifice everything!
READ MORE

Helpful customer reviews
About Reviews
39 of 51 people (76%) found this review helpful
10.4 hrs on record
Posted: September 20
A great blend of strategy, Rogue Like, and Post Apocolypotic sci-fi. Its beautiful and funny, and has a great style. This game will punch you in the face with its difficulty, but in a good way.

59 of 85 people (69%) found this review helpful
2
1 person found this review funny
7.4 hrs on record
Posted: September 20

Developer: Skyshine Games
Publisher: Versus Evil
Release Date: 16 September, 2015
Before you’re reading anything let me tell you this: The game is hard
There’s a lot to be said about this game so this will be a rather long Review.
That means there’s a lot of those words that you actually have to read, Duh.
You have been warned.
Anyway let’s dive into Bedlam together shall we?
StoryYou’re the Mechanic, the last known Member of a once thriving guild of brilliant inventors and intrepid travelers. Sounds bad ♥♥♥ doesn’t it? But that’s not it!
You’re also in charge of a Crew, which will fight and ultimately die for you in Battles, while you have to manage your resources and upgrade the ever living ♥♥♥♥ out of your trusty Dozer, the Boneshaker, while navigating through the Wasteland that is Bedlam.
GameplayAs the Mechanic you take Control of your faithful Dozer, the Boneshaker (sweet name Pal), and a bunch of other People. You probably won't have company for long since Bedlam is a grim and dark place and most of your companions, be it goons that fight to the death for you or just some passengers, have a pretty big chance of ending up with a Bullet or Fist in their Face (head) or they decorate a Pike with one or more Limbs … or the Head. To make it short dead. Anyway don’t get too friendly with them. If you manage to be lovey dovey with one or some of your Companions they might end up turning into real Bad Asses also known as Veterans. After earning three kills your Pal turns into this shiney and white Veteran and gains a Damage or Health Point bonus. A Veteran can then level up again after snagging five Kills.
So your Dozer let’s talk about it.
In order to advance through Bedlam you need Crude andMeat. The first one is fuel for the Boneshaker
and the other one for your Crew. I mean a Girl’s gotta eat. There are several ways to snag Fuel. The most common one is to kill Bad Guys on the Battlefield. If you manage to snag some of the Boxes you might end up with double Crude or Meat or evenPower Cells.
The other one is by visitingPOI, short for Point of Interest, and encountering random People that either give you some for free because they like your Face, look at you beautiful!, or they want to trade it for something.
OhPower Cells? I nearly forgot those. Oh boy those are awesome!
You need those to upgrade your Dozer. There are four Rooms that you can upgrade and each of those Rooms can reach Level five.
One of those Rooms is responsible for healing your Crew and reduces the amount of days it takes. The other one decreases either the amount of Crude or Meat used per Day whereas the last one decreases the amount of Power Cells it takes for you to use Weapons or Equalizers (more about those later).
So the whole Veteran thing ... I guess you see where this is going?
Find Bad Guys -> Kill Bad Guys with the same Guy -> ? -> Profit.
Yeah that’s not a good idea. On paper it might be but in general it’s a terrible one.
I’ll explain shortly but let’s take about combat and your friends first. Heh friends ....
So anyway the game features a two action turn. That means that you have two actions per turn (Duh!). So what exactly does that mean? You can move and then shoot someone in the Face or do either of those twice. That’s it. The enemy can do the same so you’re on equal Grounds. Unless the Blitz Meter
fills but let’s take about that later.
So let’s talk about your Crew for a while.
The game features four Classes.
The Frontliners are the Meat Shields of your Group. They have the highest Movement Range but the lowest Damage. In general you want to retrieve all those lil’ Boxes on the Battlefield with those Guys since it’s the easiest way to do it with them.
Next up are the Deadeyes. Yup you guessed it, those are filthy Snipers. Since Snipers are a bunch of cowardly Jackasses, they have to stay back so they, hopefully won’t get sniped (always makes me giggle when this actually happens). They have the highest Damage, of course, but the lowest Movement Range, not to mention they have a very specific attack range so you have to be in a good Spot to kill some People in their Faces.
And if you’re missing Shotguns here are the Trenchers. Those guys are the average Joes/Janes of Bedlam. They deal medium damage and have a medium Movement Range but in exchange for that their Attacks knock Enemies back. So make good use of’em Pal.
Last but not least are the crazy ones, the Gunslingers. Yeah those guys must’ve mistaken Bedlam with the Wild West since their acting like Pistoleros. They also feature medium Movement Range and Damage but whenever they take Damage from an Enemy in Range they get ♥♥♥♥♥♥ and Shoot Back. Oh yeah that’s right you better kill them with one shot or they’ll just unload a Clip right into your
Balls you filthy cowardly Mutant!
Face.
You might even run into some
odd
special looking Fellas while cruising through Bedlam. If you manage to defeat those Posers they will join your Crew and Boy let me tell you … If you manage to do so the Battles will become so, oh so much easier! Not to mention those can level up as well. So take good care of those Buddy.
Remember me mentioning theBlitz Meter? Good, well let’s talk about the Meat of the Game for a while the Combat.
Combat in this game takes a lot of thinking. You can’t just rush in and one man show the whole Battlefield, unless you wanna end up Dead. So make use of that thing between your Shoulders.
You start of with random positions on the Battlefield. There are certain object you can take Cover behind and if you choose to do so you do gain one bonus: Being able to Dodge.
Unless you hide, glorious I must say, behind something you will always get hit. Always, there’s no way around it but the same goes for your Enemies.
Besides that you have to think twice whether or not you’re moving this character to kill this Idiot because it might be that you lose another one in the next Round due to him being too close to another unfriendly Unit.
Welcome to later! Time to talk about the fun stuff!
Weapons and Equalizers. Let’s be honest. There comes a time where you just go What the actual BEEP!?
, because you find yourself outnumbered. There’s no way that you can win this Battle. Not a Chance. Unless you use some Weapons or Equalizers. You could either Nuke them down for example (always fun when Stuff just goes BOOM!) or you could heal Crew on the field. The choice is all yours but be advises that those all need Power Cells so it’s best to keep some at the back of your Dozer. Just for worst case Scenarios. I mean everything is a worst Case Scenarios but I mean real worst Case Scenarios.
VisualsWell it’s okay. I can’t say it’s bad nor good. I mean at the end of the day it does fit the game perfectly but I would have liked to see more Diversity. By that I mean if you’re on the Battlefield every Class looks exactly the same. Unless it’s a special Unit or a Veteran.
Besides that the game does look good. You always have the feeling that you’re
♥♥♥♥ed
in a Wasteland full of Mutants, Rogue A.I, you name it.
The game does look really good but again … Just some diversity would have been dope.
SoundIt does fit the game. It’s not perfect and lacks here and there but overall it’s good. Though I have to admit that I do get a
Borderlands
Vibe, which I greatly enjoyed and consider one of my favorite Game Series, so I might be biased in that regard but the sounds overall are quite fitting. The explosions, Shots and Enemies are all fitting and keep you in the Wasteland.
What else can I say?Skyshine’s Bedlam is a good game. Yes it’s hard but People come on. It’s a Rogue-Like.
36 of 46 people (78%) found this review helpful
4.9 hrs on record
Posted: September 20

Having heard about this game from the FTL I was super excited to get my hands on it - in the trailer it looked to like a combination of FTL (world) and fallout/xcom (battle).
I'm ~5 hours into the game at the time of writing and am having a blast. Make no mistake, this game is challenging - it will not hold your hand and you'll need to do a bit of trial and error with troop placement, and using all your troops. At the moment, I'm nearing the end of a run that will likely be a victory but I lost ~4 runs and quit 2 more due to running low on soldiers.
There are definitely things that can be improved upon, but given that the devs are a team of three and they are incredibly active with the community I'm not at all worried that we'll have a really polished game in the upcoming months.
When I started I was literally trading unit for unit with the enemy - after a few frustrating (but fun!) runs I was learning to position my troops, use my items effectively, and take out 10+ enemies without losing a single soldier.
Highly recommended if you enjoy turn based strategic combat.
46 of 63 people (73%) found this review helpful
12.9 hrs on record
Posted: September 21

At first, this rogue-like game's difficultly is just brutal, but once you get the hang of it, it is incredibly fun. The soundtrack is amazing and there are an endless amount of different random encounters (POIs) that really add to the replayability. Definitely worth playing, especially to wreak havoc with dozer weapons.
53 of 75 people (71%) found this review helpful
5.5 hrs on record
Posted: September 23

I loved this game. It might not be the most polished or balanced, but is great fun. There is a lot to do, the artwork is fantastic, the gameplay is satisfying and the strategy really matters. Hopefully they continue to update and change it for the better, as the only con here is slight imbalance across certain features such as weapons and equalizers, but it didn't affect my enjoyment of this amazing title. Props to the developers.
